description: The proposed solution aims to discover all internet-facing APIs of the media organization, including various types like RESTful (JSON, XML), GraphQL, SOAP, XML-RPC, and gRPC.
It supports different protocols such as HTTP/HTTPS, WebSocket, and MQTT to ensure no API is left unscanned.

To access protected APIs for comprehensive testing, the scanning service includes support for various authentication mechanisms like OAuth 2.0 (Bearer tokens, Client Credentials), JWT, API keys, Basic Auth, Digest Auth, and SAML.
The solution performs automated vulnerability scanning on the discovered APIs, checking for security issues as per OWASP API Security Top 10.
Broken Object Level Authorization (BOLA): Testing for unauthorized access to resources by manipulating object identifiers.
Broken Authentication: Checking for weaknesses that allow attackers to assume identities of other users or escalate privileges.
Excessive Data Exposure: Identifying endpoints that reveal sensitive data not intended for the user.
Lack of Resources & Rate Limiting: Verifying the presence of rate limiting mechanisms to prevent abuse and DoS attacks.
Broken Function Level Authorization: Ensuring that proper access controls are enforced on API endpoints based on user roles.
Mass Assignment: Detecting if input fields can be manipulated to modify unintended attributes or gain unauthorized access.
Security Misconfiguration: Scanning for misconfigured settings, open cloud storage buckets, and other security flaws.
Injection: Testing for SQL injection, OS command injection, XML/JSON injections that can lead to data theft or system compromise.
Improper Assets Management: Identifying outdated libraries, unpatched vulnerabilities, and insecure dependencies used by the APIs.
Insufficient Logging and Monitoring: Checking for lack of logging mechanisms that could help detect and investigate security incidents.
Findings from the API vulnerability scans are integrated into the media organization's existing Archer Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) system.
This allows for centralized tracking, reporting, and remediation workflows within their current risk management framework.
The service enables configuring scheduled scans of the APIs on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis.
Post each scan, detailed vulnerability reports are generated in a format compatible with Archer GRC system's ingestion capabilities for seamless integration.
Ensuring data security, all communication between the scanning service and the media organization's systems (APIs, Archer GRC) is encrypted using industry-standard protocols like TLS 1.2 or higher.
Sensitive data at rest is also encrypted with AES-256 encryption standard, and access to stored data is controlled through role-based access control (RBAC) mechanisms and multi-factor authentication.

STEP_DETAILS: The goal is to create an API security vulnerability scanning service for a media organization that will scan all internet-facing APIs and report findings back to their Archer GRC system.

The solution performs automated vulnerability scanning on the discovered APIs, checking for security issues as per OWASP API Security Top 10.
Broken Object Level Authorization (BOLA): Testing for unauthorized access to resources by manipulating object identifiers.
Broken Authentication: Checking for weaknesses that allow attackers to assume identities of other users or escalate privileges.

Insufficient Logging and Monitoring: Checking for lack of logging mechanisms that could help detect and investigate security incidents.
Post each scan, detailed vulnerability reports are generated with severity levels (Critical, High, Medium, Low) and remediation guidance.
The reports highlight the vulnerable API endpoints, attack payloads used, and steps to reproduce the issues for verification.
Findings from the API vulnerability scans are integrated into the media organization's existing Archer Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) system.
This allows for centralized tracking, reporting, and remediation workflows within their current risk management framework.
The scanning service is designed to handle large volumes of APIs efficiently with minimal performance overhead.
It employs distributed scanning techniques and can scale horizontally to accommodate growing API inventories without degradation in scan quality or speed.
The solution utilizes advanced fingerprinting algorithms and heuristics to minimize false positives in vulnerability detection.
It employs manual verification processes for critical findings to ensure accuracy before reporting them to the Archer GRC system.
The service provides an intuitive web-based interface for configuring scans, viewing results, and managing API inventories.
It offers customizable dashboards, filters, and search capabilities to help users quickly navigate through the findings and prioritize remediation efforts.
The scanning service adheres to industry security standards and frameworks such as OWASP API Security Top 10, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, and ISO 27001.
It ensures that the discovered APIs comply with these standards and highlights any deviations or non-compliances in the vulnerability reports.
The solution employs strong encryption (TLS 1.2+) for all data in transit between the scanning service, APIs, and Archer GRC system.
It also implements robust access controls and authentication mechanisms to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive vulnerability data.
The service provides well-documented APIs for seamless integration with the Archer GRC system, enabling automated syncing of vulnerability data.
It also supports importing API definitions (e.g., OpenAPI/Swagger) to enhance scanning accuracy and coverage.
The solution offers configurable webhooks and email notifications to alert security teams of critical vulnerabilities in real-time.
It allows setting up custom thresholds and severity levels for triggering these alerts based on organizational risk appetite.

Perform comprehensive security scans on discovered APIs
Identify vulnerabilities such as SQL injection, XSS, broken authentication, etc.
Provide detailed vulnerability reports with severity levels and remediation guidance
Integrate with Archer GRC system for reporting and tracking
non_functional_requirements: High performance and scalability to handle large numbers of APIs
Low false positive rate to reduce manual verification efforts
Easy to use interface for configuring scans and viewing results
Compliance with industry security standards (e.g. OWASP Top 10)
Strong encryption and access controls to protect sensitive data
integration_requirements: APIs to enable integration with Archer GRC system
Ability to import API definitions (e.g. OpenAPI/Swagger) for more accurate scanning
Webhooks or email notifications for real-time alerts on critical vulnerabilities

description: The API discovery module is responsible for identifying all internet-facing APIs of the media organization.
It should support various API types (RESTful, GraphQL, SOAP, etc.) and protocols (HTTP/HTTPS, WebSocket, MQTT) to ensure comprehensive coverage.
The vulnerability scanning engine conducts automated security testing on the discovered APIs.
It should check for issues as per OWASP API Security Top 10 and generate detailed findings for each identified vulnerability.
This component is responsible for generating vulnerability reports post scanning and integrating the findings with the Archer GRC system.
It should ensure compatibility with Archer GRC's data ingestion formats and workflows.
A user-friendly interface is required for configuring scan schedules, viewing scan results, managing alerts, and performing other administrative tasks.
The UI should provide role-based access control and secure authentication mechanisms.
Robust backend infrastructure (servers, databases) is necessary to support the API scanning service.
It should ensure high availability, scalability, and data security through encryption, backup, and access control measures.

STEP_DETAILS: API discovery module to identify all internet-facing APIs
Vulnerability scanning engine with comprehensive testing capabilities
Reporting and integration component for Archer GRC system
User interface for configuring scans, viewing results, managing alerts
Backend infrastructure (servers, databases) to support the service

description: The solution implements role-based access control (RBAC) to ensure users have appropriate permissions based on their job responsibilities.
It includes predefined roles such as Administrator with full system control, Security Analyst for managing scan results, and Read-only access for auditors and stakeholders.
The service integrates with the media organization's existing corporate single sign-on (SSO) system to streamline user authentication.
It enforces strong password policies, including complexity requirements and regular updates, along with mandatory multi-factor authentication for enhanced security.

role_based_access_control: Administrator role with full control over system configuration
Security analyst role with ability to view and manage scan results
Read-only access for auditors and other stakeholders
authentication_mechanisms: Integrate with corporate single sign-on (SSO) system
Enforce strong password policies and multi-factor authentication

description: The proposed solution will integrate with the media organization's existing Archer Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) system for tracking vulnerabilities and managing remediation workflows.
It will also leverage the corporate directory services for user authentication and authorization to ensure secure access to the API scanning service.
The solution will aim to leverage existing API management tools and gateways already in use by the media organization, ensuring seamless integration.
It will be designed for compatibility with the organization's IT infrastructure and security controls, adhering to established standards and protocols.

existing_systems_integration: Archer GRC system for vulnerability tracking and remediation workflows
Corporate directory services for user authentication and authorization
technology_stack_alignment: Leverage existing API management tools and gateways where possible
Ensure compatibility with organization's IT infrastructure and security controls

description: Developing a comprehensive project plan that outlines the key milestones, resource requirements, timeline, and success criteria for implementing the API security scanning solution.

The plan will include a phased approach for rollout, starting with a pilot phase on a subset of APIs to validate the solution's effectiveness and fine-tune configurations before expanding to cover all internet-facing APIs of the media organization.
Key milestones in the project plan will include: requirements gathering, tool selection and configuration, pilot testing, full deployment, and ongoing maintenance and optimization.
Resource requirements will detail the necessary personnel (cybersecurity analysts, developers, network administrators), software licenses, hardware infrastructure, and budget allocations.
The timeline will provide a realistic estimate of the duration for each phase, taking into account dependencies and potential risks that could impact the schedule.

Success criteria will be clearly defined to measure the effectiveness of the API security scanning solution in identifying vulnerabilities, reducing risk exposure, and integrating with existing security workflows and tools like Archer GRC.

STEP_DETAILS: Develop a detailed project plan outlining key milestones, resource requirements, timeline, and success criteria. Include a phased approach for rollout, starting with a pilot on a subset of APIs.
